Reviews.Title: “clean ,comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: shunt123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two years ago.for five nights.I found the hotel very clean and friendly-My room looked out onto the street so you could hear early morning street noise if your windows where open but if was very quiet if they were closed.The breakfast room was in the basement.The continental breakfast was good.I loved the small inner courtyard where you can enjoy the fresh air.The area around the hotel was brilliant - I loved the open market being so close by.It is less than a 5 minute walk to the metro station and I would definitely return here .

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel, Clean, in good Location”
Reviews.Author: FAMILYNI
Reviews.Content: Hi have meant to write this review last year. My husband and I stayed here last May for our Wedding Anniversary and we were not disappointed. The Hotel is in a quiet location but still has good walking distance to good restaurants and pubs. It was a 15- 20 min walk to the attractions. The Staff were friendly and spoke good English Breakfast was fine you always left with a full tummy. Hotel is small but you are aware of that before you book. Rooms clean and modern. If fancy a feel for what Paris has to offer I would recommend this Hotel as its not a chain like your Holiday Inns, Premier Lodges, Its quaint and Beautiful leading you into little streets where you get a feel for Paris and not just the sights. Chez Leon is a wonderful place to eat and is just round the corner from the hotel Red Bus tour well worth the money can stop off and get on through all the sights. Book this hotel and enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, well priced, comfortable Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: fletchmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from a Saturday to Tuesday on a sightseeing trip to Paris. The room was clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was plentiful and the people at the front desk were friendly and helpful, and they spoke good English, which helped when my French ran out! The hotel is in the 17 arrondissement, so a little way out, but we walked everywhere although the Villiers metro station is very close. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Eileen D
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice now, and will come back again. It's the perfect place to stay. Quiet, with a great location. About a 5 minute walk to the nearest Metro station, great restaurants even closer and everything you'd really need just down a block and a half.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FudgeSurrey
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of 3 couples and were located together on the 3rd floor. This hotel is in a quiet location with easy access to metro station, grocery (and cake) stores with plenty of bars and restaurants close by (nice café/bar around the corner by daily street market). We walked to the river Seine on our first day via the Champs Elysees, which took a couple of hours as we stopped on several occasions to spend time in places of interest, shops, churches etc. We enjoyed being in a typical Parisian neighbourhood which was not touristy at all. Staff speak good English (so no need to worry if your French is rusty) and were friendly and welcoming (as were all the Parisians we met). We arrived 2 hours early and had emailed in advance to see if we could store our luggage if rooms unavailable. This was possible but was not necessary as our rooms were ready early. We were also permitted to leave our luggage on our 3rd day till long after check out which was very much appreciated as we could make the most of our last day in Paris (train home was at 2013). Breakfast is in a charming little room in the basement and was good with plenty of coffee, tea, juice, fresh bread, croissants, pastries, toast, yoghurt & fruit and was complimentary which was a nice bonus. We didn’t use the garden as it was -10 degrees during our stay, but would imagine it would be nice to sit out during the summer with a glass of wine! Our room (36) was very warm and comfortable (especially the bed which is important after a long day walking around Paris). Air con also available for the summer months. Facilities/room clean and plenty of hot water for shower. Free electronic safe was useful to lock away valuables. Very quiet location with no street noise or from other rooms/residents. In essence, this is a very nice little hotel in a convenient location and nice neighbourhood and we would recommend staying here – when we return to Paris, we shall definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: djt46
Reviews.Content: Picked this off the internet and the pictures look quite good but the reality is tiny rooms, okay it is Europe, pokey bathroom and little room to move. Saving grace was finding Le P'tit Canon restaurant just down the road, an abolsolute gem

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for Paris weekenders from the UK”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quiet and and unpretentious with friendly staff. It is situated in the very pleasant Parisian 'village' of Villiers. Nice restaurants and shops 2 minutes walkaway in Rue de Levis including daily street market. We received a warm welcome with a quick check in. At the end of our stay the checkout was equal simple and we were also able to leave our bags after at the hotel until our airport pick up arrived. We used a shared ride which was 30 minutes to Orly on a Monday afternoon in light traffic. Excellent buffet style serve yourself breakfast. Hotel quiet at night which is what we wanted after a full days sightseeing. Nice to have the use of a free electronic safe in the room for valuables. Villiers metro is 6 minutes walk away. 22 minutes stroll to Arc de Triomphe, and 30 to Montmartre. Reception staff spoke English when our French ran out of steam !

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Robbie2604
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after a nightmare experience in another hotel around the corner. I was stressed when I walked in, and the receptionist (or perhaps the owner, not sure) was kind, considerate, friendly (apparently rare in Paris), professional, yet with a great sense of humour...and made me feel welcome...and that was even before I checked in. He gave me a key to check the available room, and it was a good size, was clean and overlooked a lovely courtyard. I've had a great stay so far, and have extended, and I feel peaceful here....I'm so glad I found it. There are some great shops (food, wine, cheese, pastries, clothes etc etc) one street away....it's a great location....and I HIGHLY recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I would leave a Zero but that was not an option”
Reviews.Author: Dan B
Reviews.Content: This ranks up there as my top 5 worst stays in a hotel. I would like to start by saying I am not a picky traveler, all I really want is a hot shower, a comfortable bed and decent service. I will go into detail so the readers will see why this stay was so poor. We arrived and received a key to an already occupied room. It was over a Christmas holiday so easily a mistaken that could be made and forgivable. The second day of the stay , we arrive back at our room and although we left up the do not disturb sign our room had been cleaned, again no issues, just a little annoying. The third day after touring Paris, we arrive back to no power on the third and fourth floor, we were staying on the third, slightly annoying, but fine. The fourth night we arrive back from touring Paris to find out, that somehow it was our room that caused the power outage, water in the outlet, and it was "not our fault". We did not have any 220 plugs, so we had not plugged anything in, and had no water issues. The fifth night we arrive after midnight mass around 3 AM to find the TV had fallen out of the wall and there was plaster everywhere. We immediately told the on desk person, and next morning were informed that this too was "not our fault". We had no TV for the last two days, whatever it is Paris we weren't there to watch TV. On check out we asked about the myriad of problems and we were told that we would have 10 Euro off our nex stay at the hotel. We politely informed them, if they needed the money that bad keep it, since there would be no next stay. We chose the hotel for it's location to family in the city, it was our first time and the neighborhood was amazing, our time in Paris was amazing but the hotel was awful.

Reviews.Title: “CLOSE TO VILLIERS METRO STATION AND RUE DE LEVIS STREET MARKET”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is down a quiet street just around the corner from Rue de Levis Market Street, which has all you need for daily living such as bakeries, pastry shops, grocery stores, meat and cheese stores, fruit stands, variety stores, ATM's, and more. It is close to Villiers Metro station. It included a light breakfast in a cute room in the basement. Clerks were helpful. Room was clean, comfortable, and had air conditioning free wifi and TV with English channels. It had a shower and deep bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Roman D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in mid December for 2 night and highly enjoyed it. The staff are very friendly and are always happy to help, which was a great start. The room itself is a little small but has everything that you need, modern and comfortable, and the bathroom is very clean and modern. Everything that you need for a good stay in Paris. Great location and we will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: anettethore
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice area. Room fairly comfortable and nice breakfast. Bathroom old fashioned and the radiator sounds like a waterfall (room 45). Standard not as high as you expect from the photos online but hey, for Paris how much can you expect for that kind of money?

Reviews.Title: “Trés Bon!”
Reviews.Author: Vikki B
Reviews.Content: Central location. Safe area. Friendly & helpful staff. Average breakfast. Modern room. Clean bathroom. Enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in an ideal location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: ColinPage
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in early November. The room was small, but had everything we needed. The hotel location is fantastic - 5 minutes walk to the metro and then only a few stops to all the sights. You can also walk to sacre coeur, moulin rouge and the champs élysées if you want. There are some lovely restaurants near the hotel if you don't fancy going back into the city at night. All in all, we found the hotel jardin de villiers to be a great choice for exploring all that Paris has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Some disappointments - but probably okay!”
Reviews.Author: John_CornerBrook
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel commenced at 1 am following a taxi ride from the railway station. To our surprise, the front of the building, which looked vacant, was covered with construction material. No outside lights were on. The 'clerk' who met us was dressed in a tee shirt and looked unkempt. A bed was set up in the front lobby. Where were we??? Being too tired to go elsewhere, we took our room and spent the night worrying. The following morning, the new desk clerk was dressed appropriately, the bed was gone and everything seemed fine. We decided to stay, writing off our late evening entry as a bit of an anomoly. The hotel is reasonable for a 3-star European properety. Rooms are small but clean, well decorated and maintained. The elevator is tiny, so my wife who is somewhat claustophobic refused to use it, taking four flights of stairs instead. If you don't like tiny elevators, ask for a room on a lower floor. The garden that they advertise is quite small and looked forlorn in late October. The surrounding buildings are not attractive and so detract from the appearance of that garden. Breakfast was small but adequate with only cold items as is the norm on that continent. It is provided in a basement 'cavern' which is well lit and charming, but the tables are very small and jammed in there. In high season, it might be a challenge to find a space. This boutique hotel is on a quiet street, seems to be well managed and, absent the oddities that we experienced on our first night, it may be a reasonable place to stay in Paris. By now, the reconstruction of the exterior front may be complete. It is only a short walk to the Metro and perhaps a 15/20 minute walk to the Champs-Elysses. There are a number of decent restaurants and cafes nearby, as well as a market street which was fascinating with foods and clothing for sale in sidewalk booths. While we can't highly recommend the J de V, because our early experiences there were rather odd, it may offer a good choice for travellers wanting a decent and clean place to stay in a quiet neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back in a heartbeat!!”
Reviews.Author: Terry W
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been more pleased with every detail about this hotel on my first trip to Paris. Because of it's location, I was able to go everywhere I wanted to visit by walking or by metro (also walking distance from hotel) If you don't want to leave the neighborhood, there is still plenty to keep you entertained in true Parisian style and all the charm you expect from Paris. I was a novice tourist with limited French. The staff was so accomodating and knowledgable. They researched any information they didn't have on hand to answer all of my questions and find locations and activities for me. They also made arrangements for our daytime excursions as well as airport transportation. I don't think I would have been able to have such a great Parisian experience without their help. The rooms were small, but pristine and immaculate. I was there to shower and sleep, so that more than met my needs. I was surprised at how modern the bathroom was. I also thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast room for it's convenience, character and of course, the food. Some of the extras included free wifi that I used while relaxing on the garden patio. I would recommend this quaint experience for anyone who plans on experiencing Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option;good location”
Reviews.Author: Beancounter40
Reviews.Content: We booked a quick trip to Paris by Eurostar with a budget hotel option.I cannot fault the hotel; it has a great,convenient location (near two metro stations, entirely possible to walk into the centre of Paris in half an hour or so aswell).The staff were super pleasant and charming (without exception- we were there three nights) and dealt patiently with queries.Very helpful with information.Room was smallish but clean and had a good bathroom.Coffee and kettle provided -hurrah! Breakfast entirely adequate and available from 7am.Would definitely consider another stay.Local shops are good too.

Reviews.Title: “"Little Gem'”
Reviews.Author: SaffiSheffield
Reviews.Content: Great location,clean, lovely and helpful staff, great breakfast with good choice, the world's comfiest bed and pillows, constant hot water and great power shower. Small (but perfectly adequate) rooms but all the rooms in Paris are small - so what - you are only sleeping there after all. Yes there was scaffolding and sheeting up to the front of the hotel for ongoing work when we were there - mid October - but this didnt affect us as we had a bedroom overlooking the garden - I would check this out at the time of booking. Lots of bars, cafes etc in close location to the hotel - try the Petite Canon - excellent food (very good portions) and great service. I was there with my grown up daughter and we felt very safe walking around at night. Very easy to get to the metro and only a few stops to get to some of Paris' best sights. Would go back. All-in-all a 'Little Gem' of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, cosy Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: cityshopper10
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews: this hotel is a very good choice for weekend getaway in Paris. Jardin de Villiers is a charming and cosy small hotel in a lovely neighbourhood. The rooms are quite small but nicely decorated. Personel is friendly and does its best to help in any situation. Breakfast was included the room price and it was ok start for the day. The only complain was the breakfast room was tiny and there was always something missing from the table - cheese, coffee, glasses... The waiter brought more of everything when asked. The location is good and you can quite easily walk to the Triumph or Montmartre. The neighbourhood is charming and there are some nice restaurants just nearby. The street and the hotel itself are very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: sophie_0128
Reviews.Content: I will not repeat the reviews written by others here on how great the restaurants and markets are near this hotel and how short the distance is to get from hotel to many interesting postcard -perfect places. The reviews are true. Location is quiet, safe, and you won't go hungry around here. BUT.... the hotel can stand to raise its level of cleanliness. There is a garden at the back but the 4 tables there hold overflowing ashtrays most days I was there. One day, someone finally decided to clean the ashtrays but took so long to return them to the tables in the garden so smokers littered the garden with cigarette butts. They also said wifi is free... that is if you can connect to wifi at all. On our first day, we had a very strong signal in our room at the 4th floor. The rest of our stay, we had to make trips to the ground floor (or to the garden) to get a signal. Or, I stand outside my room near the staircase and I get a signal when I am lucky, but not always. Yes, we told the front desk (many times actually I almost sounded like I was whining)... Laurent, Jean-Paul, and the 2 different men who manned the night shift. But not much success. We also paid extra for a room with a balcony (where I can smoke). But we were not told the facade of the building was undergoing a face lift (although I never saw anyone working during the 4 days I was there) so the scaffolding covered the balcony, and it was very dusty. Someone posted a review here with a picture of the hotel's facade. I read the reviews for this hotel before I went to Paris for the very first time, so my expectations over the breakfast fare, the size of the room, etc. were managed.... so except for the erratic wifi connection (which was very important to me as I had to communicate with people almost halfway across the globe, 6 time zones away), I consciously looked beyond these "imperfections" as Laurent and Jean Paul assisted me with making arrangements for shuttle service and allowed me to print my boarding pass from their computers. And yes, there's the elevator, and air conditioning to be thankful for too. Great location.... don't expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Jardin de Villiers, Rue Claude Pouillet,Paris,France.”
Reviews.Author: Brianandnikki
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardin de Villiers tucked away up a small quiet side street, Rue Claude Puillet, a couple of hundred yards from Villiers Metro station. I noticed a garage at the bottom of the road so could park the car there if needed. Lively area, some nice affordable restauarants nearby, The Village for one, good street market, lots of foodie stalls. Hotel. Staff exceptional with info, fluent English spoken, rooms a tad small, but thats Paris !!. Bathroom, A/C , TV ( BBC ) all worked fine. Un stocked mini bar but useful as a fridge to store wine purchased from the Nicolas Wine shop just around the corner. Very clean throughout, a nice classy family run small Paris Hotel. I'd like to see breakfast served in the charming garden which seems to be a bit wasted, unless you are a smoker !! Breakfast was a little more than adequate, cheese, yoghurt, nice fresh fruit salad but I like to have seen some 'real' cheese and some ham and maybe a boiled egg or two. Took my 83 year old Mother and they gave us next door rooms on the ground floor, which was nice. Scaffold on the outside of building was a bit of a downer but presume not permanent. The three of us, 2 x 59 year olds and 1x 83 year old thought it a bit of a --- on the Metro with bags and stuff from Gard du Nord, one change quite a few steps so took a cab back for 22 euros. Go back ?? it's on the list. Brianandnikki

Reviews.Title: “In Paris like the Parisians”
Reviews.Author: EduardoRio
Reviews.Content: Well, Paris... Do you know Paris? No! But you will!!! Yes, well you'll probably agree with me that it's hard to chose a hotel at the "City of Light"! Why? There are a lot of. small ones, Big, Old, New! But one thing, I think, is mandatory when I'm about to chose a hotel. In spite of many other questions as towels and room size, the hotel location is half way to a good stay, mostly at a big city. Also, nothing is better than come into(a little, at least) the city life. So, Jardin De Villiers, plays exactly this role. The hotel Stile is a lot of the "Paris stile". Old, but well maintained, Clean, good mattress, towels, not so spacious, small number of rooms, etc. But, the best. You'll not be at a touristic place. No, you'll be at a Parisian neighborhood, surrounded by markets, "Bulangeries", restaurants, bars and local's apartments. Few steps to Metro, Walk 20 minutes and Voila you are et Arc de Triumph, few more steps, The Eifel Tower, the Seine River, the Louvre... That said, no matter if you know Paris or not, if you like to get the felling of be part of the place where you are going to go. Keep the Villiers in mind. PS: The hotel breakfast place is a charm, there is at the underground in place that looks like a cavern. I would recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely area of Paris to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: EVWA123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with three girlfriends. Rooms comfortable and clean. Kettle, tea and milk provided as well as a fridge. Good location away from central Paris but fairly close to a Metro Station. Good breakfast, although garden not always available. Staff polite. Able to leave luggage on the final morning before leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kris C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Great location to get into the centre of Paris for sight seeing. (4 stops from Opera). Villiers (area) is a pretty suburb with nice little shops and plenty of boulangeries! Staff were very helpful and have good knowledge of the area. All reception staff spoke English really well. Breakfast well topped up and had the option to take to room. Room was clean, tidied daily and was a suitable size for a city break! If we were going back would definitely go back there again! Also offered to sort out collection from the Airport on arrival for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Location and reception staff ok, but everything else....”
Reviews.Author: Gocilia
Reviews.Content: Positive - location is excellent, on foot you need 15-20 min. to the main attractions, metro station is on 5 min. walking distance also. Neighborhood is ok, street very quiet. Reception staff is very polite and helpful. If you need any advice or recommendation they will provide you with a lot of information. Laurent was very supportive when we have some problem and helped a lot. They do not have computer available for free use but if you need to check e-mails or to find something they will offer you their computer at reception. Negative - our room was not properly cleaned for all 9 days of our stay. Spider and his net are probably hotel`s pet as they remained untouched for the whole period. Dust is everywhere and on everything, if you have allergy this could be a problem. Room is small even for European standards, no corridor, open the door and jump on the bed. Blankets on beds are terrible, worn, dusty, not even put in covers but only sheet separates you from this awful thing. Our stuff was scattered and not even one day we found them as we left, in bathroom and on tables. We have room in basement which is very unconvenient, if you open the window you can shake hands with every passerby, not to mention that we do not feel comfortable to leave it open during the night so you have to use a/c no matter of weather. Breakfast is the worst I have ever had, and I travel a lot and are not very demanding. Very, VERY limited choice, not even fresh fruit but some canned and only if you are lucky to be on time. Toaster is disgusting to see, rusted, dirty as most other utensilis. If there is not enough jam or cheese and you ask the lady she will bring you one piece and put it in your hand, no chance to supply more on serving table for others, they are obviously instructed to save the food as much as they can. So, it is budget hotel and do not expect luxury but for 3* one can ask at least clean room and decent breakfast, you will not get it in this hotel but Paris is full of hotels and check as many trustworthy reviews as you can, this hotel on web site and in reality are very different.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem. A great location. In a city you discover by stumbling upon!”
Reviews.Author: thewiredwanderer
Reviews.Content: The Jardin De Villiers is a gem – which we found on TripAdvisor. Located in the 17th arondissement (district) of Paris, this hotel is warm, friendly, small, and well positioned for the Paris tourist. We were three (with our 11 year old son), and the staff made their best efforts to provide the best possible rooms and always, always, service and a welcome with a smile. We have nothing but good things to say about this little gem – which by the way, is a minute's walk away from street markets, restaurants and cafés, fruit and veggie vendors, and a pretty good sized supermarket – Monoprix. The location is really amazing. We were: • 2 minutes from the Villers Metro station • 15 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees • 20 minutes walk from Montmarte area and the Sacre-Cour (amazing views!) • 15 minute walk from Flunch – budget eatery that's a rage in Paris • About 1/2 hour's walk to the Left Bank • About a 10 minute, one-change train ride to the Eiffel Tower and more... The hotel rates are decently priced, and the room rates we had included a typical Continental Breakfast – crusty bread, (various) croissants, yogurt, fruit cups, toast, jam, cheeses, and delicious coffee and real tea. We were thrilled to find Darjeeling tea – which we found hard to find in hotels even in tea-loving England! We would haver loved to see some fresh fruit or perhaps a few slices of cold meats – but overall, we were pretty happy with breakfast – served in a very special cellar like room. The extremely cheerful staff were always at hand to re-fill anything that ran out – and although we did get bored with eating the same thing day after day for seven days – it was a great start to the day in Paris. The rooms are small but tidy. Apparently most Paris rooms are small, and we were three in a room probably meant for two, but with the additional bed the hotel provided we were fine. We had a great view from the large French windows and the balcony we had on the 4th floor. The room has an ensuite bathroom with a decent shower. The tv is basic French, and we only has like CNN and BBC on. Paris has so much to do and see, don't panic on the tv. The city has better views! And, of course, there's a quant little garden whichyou can pop out to – either with a glass of wine and a fine Cuban in the evening, or with your coffee in the morning. No comment on the rooms at the Jardin De Villiers would be complete without a comment on the beds. I have a back condition for years, but those seven nights I was near pain free. The beds are so good, we tried to track down the manufacturer. From the moment we checked in to the time we checked out, we must acknowledge the fantastic front desk staff at the JDV. Laurent who was our first point of welcome, was good humored and welcoming. Actually, every one was great. They all spoke English, and I guess they all help you, working literally like the Concierge at a larger hotel. They were very sensitive to our needs, helping us book taxis, providing little tips, maps, and great words of advice. One comment about the neighborhood... Watch out as you walk around the narrow streets – the pavements are covered with dog poo. There is no poop-and-scoop policy in Paris, and particularly where we were, this was one fresh fertilizer farm! At the end of the our week in Paris we realized we had a great time. Literally a couple of minutes from the hotel are great fruit stalls, butcheries with ready foods, great wine stores, many restaurants and bakeries – and if the doggie-do isn't overpowering on that given day, the various aromas of bread baking, chicken on the rotisserie, or fresh fruit in the sun being sold by eager, friendly farmers is amazing. Couple of words of advice on Paris: • Get the 10-pack of metro/train/bus tickets. It's called a carnet. We got ours for cash (Euro 12.50 for ten)(and slightly discounted because you buy 10 at a time). Near the JDV is the Villiers Metro station (2 mins) which easily connects to the RER trains which take you to all the main sights in Paris. • We had tickets left over because we discovered that there is so much to see just walking around in the magical (but dirty) city, that we did NOT want to be underground unless we were absolutely tired or late. • Walk along both banks of the River if you can. Both banks have their charm. Discover by stumbling upon. • Most people miss the Concorde monument – a gift from Egypt. The site of many a guillotine moment – including Marie Antoinette's! The place is amazing, surrounded by fantastic fountains, views of the Tour Eiffel and the astounding Touilerie garden. • No, the French in Paris are not like the faux-French in Montreal (we are Canadians, we know!). They will speak to you in English if they can, there is no language snobbery like most people think. We had wonderful experiences on the trains or the streets with just ordinary, every day Parisians doing great little cameos as tour guides. • Food is expensive. Wine is cheaper than water. • If you are on a budget, or just for fun try Flunch. This is a multiple outley eatery that serves decent food and all-you-can-eat sides of veggies, mash, fries etc with your main entree at ridiculous prices. The Flunch we stumbled upon was near Montmarte. • The tiny Chinese/Vietnamese/Japanese places are good deals, usually. Indian is expensive – often unexplainably so. The typical Paris bistros and cafe's are great. • Do stop for a breather at a park. The parks are a breath of fresh air (literally!). I could go on. And sound like a Paris and a hotel PR person. But we really did have such a splendid time, that we wanted to share all our positives with every one intending to go out there. One last word. From our 11-year old, for all those with pre-teen kids. No we did not go to Disneyland Paris. We found so much in the city itself, we kind of took the (kid's) road less travelled. And truth be told... he loved every moment of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: phoenixfireflame
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for the Tour De France weekend, what a great little find this Hotel is, OK it's not the most salubrious hotel and is what I would call 'shabby chic', but we paid a good price and we couldn't fault it. The beds were really comfortable and a double.. (not 3/4 which some hotels in Paris provide) the bathroom was large, clean & the shower great and the rooms (we were at the back, Room 3) really quiet & peaceful. The staff could not be faulted, all very helpful. We loved the location of this hotel, tucked away in a part of 'real' Paris with its typical daily markets, selling an array of scrumptious looking produce and the local shops & bakers. 2-3 minute walk to the Villiers Metro (the Metro is great, so easy to navigate!) On our last night, we stayed local and ate in The Village Restaurant, delicious...! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hinkochi
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Close to the subway and some excellent restaus. Quiet neighborhood. Monoprix and pharmacy 2 shorts blocks away. Firm comfortable beds. CLEAN! Kind staff. Free wi-fi. A/C and closet stocked with extra blankets and pillows. Never had their breakfast, so unable to comment (served 7-10am). Price is VERY reasonable for Paris. Rooms are small, but we don't go to Paris to hang in our room... We only use it for showering and sleeping. Our room was on the street and it had well-insulated windows... Very quiet even when pallets of scaffolding were delivered out front one morning. Will ABSOLUTELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheCarrolls
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel in an ideal location for getting around Paris. The staff are very friendly and knowledgable. The beds were amazingly comfortable. If there are alot of you in a group then the breakfast room is too small to all eat together (8 in ours). The Metro is about 5-10 minutes walk away. There are several local shops offering everything from food stuff to fashion and beauty. There is also a street market around the corner. The area also has lots of bistro style restaurants and bars. Don't rely on getting a taxi when you need one as they can't be pre-ordered. If you have to be at the station by a certain time, better to order earlier than needed. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient hotel: We would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: AA.DCM
Reviews.Content: While we wondered about the neighborhood upon arrival from CDG airport, the hotel turned out to be very good. The reception staff, particularly Lauent and Sebastein, were very welcoming and helpful. The lobby area had seating and newspapers (one English language). The room was small but fine, with a decent sized bathroom and shower area. Thankfully the AC worked fine as it was warm upon arrival, and the room was quiet. A buffet breakfast was included and the pastries, fruit, and coffee were great. Our about 5 minute walk to the Villiers metro station led us through an active street market. Cafes and a few ATM machines were scattered throughout the neighborhood. Parc Monceau was a wothwhile 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice place”
Reviews.Author: PaulPan
Reviews.Content: - Clean - Friendly and very accommodating staff - Reasonably priced - Decent location - Interesting decoration - Close to interesting local market - Free WiFi I would recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, decent and reasonably priced hotel with no delusions of grandeur.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful City, Excellent Position,We'll be back !”
Reviews.Author: helenb_35
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel to be in a fantastic position for sight seeing and loved the street markets, shops, cafes and restaurants that are so close to hand. The staff are warm, friendly and very helpful. Would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for sightseeing, comfortable hotel with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: RitaJLondon
Reviews.Content: Bedrooms are modern decor with quality fittings, continental breakfast with good selection on offer. Added advantage of small courtyard with plenty of seating and when weather allows this can be used as an additional breakfasting area. Staff deal with any queries promptly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Great Hotel And Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris2404B
Reviews.Content: If you are reading reviews about people saying the hotel is too far from the metro all I can say is they are walking to wrong way, it is no longer than a 5min walk! I went at the end of May with my girlfriend and this hotel was great, excellent price and there are well over 15 restaurants right next to the hotel. There is also a supermarket and market stalls so if you are on a budget these are a great option! We got the RER from Charles De Gaulle and then the metro line 2 to Villiers, from there waked 10 mins (didnt quite know at this point where to go) to the hotel. Our room was beautiful (I have uploaded a picture) they are a little small but it was big enough for the two of us. It was also clean and although there are some imperfections it was easy to overlook them as it did not impact our stay. I imagine most of the people complaining about the breakfast are probably American as most people seem to be expecting this huge buffet breakfast. Yes it is a buffet but it is continental which means croissants, brioche, pain au chocolat, yoghurts and a few other tasty things. Its not bacon and eggs, and to find that in France is going to be very strange. Breakfast was always nice and everything went smoothly. Smartphone Users - I have an Android and anyone else who does really should get the "Metro 01" app from the app store. If you know the name of your station and the station you want to go to (look at the metro map) then this app lets you what lines to get on and where to switch, perfect! I would give this hotel a 9/10, it was nice however it was not perfect but this shouldn't detract anyone from staying here. We were on the ground floor facing the street and we didnt hear any noise at all, also didnt hear anyone in the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ukangelique
Reviews.Content: Having had a disastrous experience with a hotel in Paris last year, I booked Jardins de Villiers with some trepidation. I needn't have worried. We received a friendly welcome, the room was clean and had all we needed for comfort and convenience - tea/coffee making facilities (very unusual for a continental hotel!), hairdryer, flat screen TV and even a safe in the room. The bathroom was spacious and water hot! There was air conditioning too which was brilliant - it always seems hot in Paris! Breakfast time offered a good choice of food in a charming converted cellar. The location was great - only a few minutes walk from Villiers Metro, and although situated in a quiet street, very close to a bustling Parisian district full of restaurants, bars and cafes, and a colourful street market. The hotel staff gave us maps and offered help with any queries we had. With regard to last year's hotel I thought, 'Never again!' After this stay, I would definitely go back to Jardins de Villiers, and can thoroughly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, warm welcome and an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Cornishman65
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Paris and it was a relief to find a hotel with such helpful staff, a clean and perfectly adequate room, and easy access to stations and the heart of the city. The continental breakfast was fine given the need to make the most of food whilst out and about! The nearby market street was excellent - we made good use of the honey shop (Famille Mary) with its vast array of honeys with wonderful flavours for gifts to take home. One of the restaurants recommended by the hotel, ?Les Petit Cannons, only a few doors away, proved ideal - with friendly help for poor French speakers but obviously popular with locals alike. So, many thanks to all at Jardin de Villiers, and we hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “We would use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: turant
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a lovely part of Paris with great transport links and a wonderful village feel to the neighbourhood. Set in a quiet street the hotel is off the main drag and is peaceful at night. The staff are helpful and friendly helping me to connect to the wireless network. The breakfast was very nice with a good selection of fare. The room was very comfortable set at the back of the hotel facing a pretty courtyard garden. If we were to return to Paris we would make my way back to the JDV in the first instance.

Reviews.Title: “Villiers: What a pleasant surpise”
Reviews.Author: Marian_QLD
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and we selected the Hotel Jardin de Villiers partly because of the very positive online reviews. Rue de Claude Pouillet really is a quiet street - but, as we discovered, the adjacent streets are full of interesting shops and there is a street market atmoshphere. Villiers is a great suburb - few tourists, lots of nice little bars and restaurants and the metro is not far away. We had no trouble getting around. Our room, overlooking the garden, was pleasant, though not overly large. The size was probably fairlly typical for Paris (and European cities) - but the big bathroom was certaily a bonus. Breakfast was good and the (underground!) breakfast room interesting. The Reception staff were consistently friendly and helpful and the person servicing our room did a magnificent job each day (we had a lot off stuff...). I just loved Paris - so much to see and do. It was great to use this hotel and a base - to be in the suburb of Villiers - and to have a choice of bars and and restaurants nearby. The free wifi was good too. Would certainly be happy to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Lbeno
Reviews.Content: From the start the staff were very helpfull and freindly, we found the room was clean and well laid out. The loacation of the hotel was in easy access of the Metro which made all of the tourist spots on more than 20 minutes away, but it was in a very quite street close to a street market and various restaurants. Please be aware of the pick-pockets that opperate from when you arriver to when you leave dont let them spoil a great city.

Reviews.Title: “small, friendly run hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheHays
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at Jardin de Villiers. Arrived before lunchtime & we had planned to just drop off our bags but staff were extremely helpful & made our room available for us straight away without question. The hotel is set in a quiet street which is minutes away from a bustling french market street & also the metro station. This actually made our stay all the more enjoyable as you could really get a taste of every day Parisienne life.Using the metro you were never more than 10-15 minutes from most of the popular tourist spots. The hotel was immaculate & room was cleaned every day with fresh towels also provided daily. Room was tastefully decorated although on the small side but believe this to be normal for Paris hotels. The breakfast cellar room was smaller than expected but there was never a problem with overcrowding. Also staff were extremely helpful & more than willing to make up a breakfast tray to be taken to the room instead. Breakfast overall was really good with fruit salad, yoghurts, pureed fruit, bread for toasting as well as baguette style breads, cheese, croissants & 2 types of french pastries. One type of cereal was also provided daily. The rooms are soundproofed & the curtains are blackout type which accompanied with the posturepedic mattress made for an extremely restful sleep. Hotel computer & printer was also made available in the evenings which was extremely helpful for printing out return boarding passes. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay & hope to revisit at some time in the not too distant future. Fell in love with this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: crewephil
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean, friendly staff excellent location, good restaurants within 5 minute walk good value for money would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely disappointing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zoeandjulian
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel off the back of Trip Advisor reviews for my wife's birthday. Before we left, we had good contact with Laurent at the hotel who arranged our airport transfer very swiftly. He was genuinely helpful via e-mail and put us in a confident mood prior to our arrival. When we arrived, the receptionist was amenable and we went in possibly the smallest lift in the world up to our room (room 31). You could barely get two people and a suitacse in this lift!!! We had booked a superior room which was anything but. You could hear the adjacent lift shaft very well. I actually went down to reception to check they had given us the right room. Sadly they had. The walls of the room were dusty and we had a plastic patio chair at the 'desk'. The TV wall mounting was loose and the bathroom had so many cracked tiles it was unreal. The shower screen was too small so the bathroom floor got soaking wet but we decided to give it the benefit of the doubt and see how the weekend went. The next morning, we went down to breakfast and were stunned at how small the breakfast room was (the hotel website photo is very misleading). For a hotel with 26 rooms, there were eight tables in there with only some of them dressed. Eventually the staff bought out some plates etc but to be honest there was no point as the selection was poor. It's not like we got down there just before breakfast ended, we were quite early. The next day, we had been out all day and came back for a freshen up prior to going out to dinner. It was about 4.30pm and we were a bit bemused to see the entrance was locked. Pressing the bell got no response. Eventually, our banging on the door woke the receptionist up from his sleep he was enjoying in the reception seating area and he let us in. I couldn't get his name as he wasn't wearing a name badge. He looked like we were asking a lot of him to be let in!!! This is inexcusable. He didn't even apologise. The next morning, the usual problems with breakfast, had to wait about 5 minutes before a member of staff realised we were waiting for some plates and off she walked whilst sighing to get them. The hotel itself is quite well located for the Metro at Villiers and outside the hotel is a nice market selling great fresh fruit and bakery items. Unfortunately just one of few positives. When we checked out, nobody asked us how our stay had been or seemed remotely interested in if we were happy with our room and to be honest I got the impression they didn't really care. I know a lot of people have rated this hotel highly but I just can't see it. Whether we were unlucky or just went at a bad time for the hotel I don't know but it was very disappointing. If you are going to Paris, stay elsewhere!! We are not snobs, nor do we stay in lavish hotels but this was one of the worst hotel experiences we have had and it really spoilt the weekend. I hope the staff read this and learn from it to prevent more disappointed travellers feeling let down.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb hotel, all our needs were met.”
Reviews.Author: katesillars
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with this hotel, the room was clean and comfortable and very quiet with a superb bathroom with both bath and shower. It was in a very safe, interesting area from which we could walk to the main sights and very easily get the metro back. The light over the sink was not working when we arrived but they fixed it straight away and they were always helpful. The breakfast was very good and ranged from fresh fruit, yoghurt to cereals and plenty of different breads which were always replenished regularly. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A true Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: kellross173
Reviews.Content: Happy New Year Jardin de Villiers! Aaaah such memories..we are return visitors to this wonderful hotel - it has everything you need plus the ambience of Paris. The breakfast is good enough ...particularly as you have the amazing market street rue de Levis just around the corner with a street full of amazing French food. It is in a great area - quiet but close to everything including the Metro. We went to New York in 2010 but hope to be back at the Jardin de Villiers very soon - especially to see the new renovations and sit in the lovely courtyard and drink some champagne - staff really obliging - Bonjour and bon chance Jardin de Villier from the Waddingtons in Australia!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdaDowsett
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely hotel before Christmas. The rooms were well-decorated and clean, the staff friendly, and the breakfasts delicious - good coffee. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and relaxing hotel from which to explore Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Mark2011
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and relaxing hotel run by very welcoming staff. The room was clean and quite spacious. The room also had air conditioning which wasn't mentioned on the Eurostar booking website - which was a bonus. The choice of drinks and food at breakfast was excellent. The hotel is situated in a very nice area of Paris with lots of places to shop and eat nearby. It is just a 5 minutes walk from a main line metro station. It is a perfect base from which to explore Paris... highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit for me in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Road_Warrior_01
Reviews.Content: I am writing again as a "repeat" guest at Hotel de Villiiers. My last trip was March 2010 with my teenage niece, who saw Paris for the first time and was enchanted by the neighborhood and hotel. I agree with recent reviewers that the breakfast situation could be improved, but encourage foreign visitors (like me) to realize that these are French breakfasts, which are "light" in comparison to breakfasts in many other cultures. I just recommended this hotel to a colleague who will visit Paris from Australia. I reiterate that this is a perfect hotel for foreigners who want to experience a touch of real Parisean life - the neighborhood, the market, the Jardin, the local cafes. And all with excellent Metro access to the rest of the city. I yearn for my next trip to Paris and stay at Hotel Jardin de Villiers. Thanks to Sebastian for his courtesy to all the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ellentreat
Reviews.Content: Ever since I discovered Jardin de Villiers, I never stay anywhere else when I visit Paris! -Small, friendly, pleasant staff ever so willing to please -Great location; quiet street, near open markets that have local products -Close to taxi and metro stop -Wonderful breakfast and a small outdoor garden in which to eat if you so desire

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lau101
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friend arrived to the hotel early and had to wait for the room to get cleaned and ready. This wasnt a problem as the staff let us leave our bags while we looked around the town. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. We stayed there for 3 nights and each afternoon there were clean towels and sheets. The front of house staff were really nice and helpful when it came to helping us plan our day on the tube as it can get confusing at times. They hand out maps and tour guides which is a nice added touch. The location of this hotel is great. You have the little town which is 5 minutes walk which has nice little shops and eating places. Its near the main tube station which takes you to the centre of Paris. Its quiet and you feel safe walking at night. The only bad point I would raise is the breakfast. The breakfast room is such a pretty little area but I think the lack of staff means it doesnt get cleaned up in time for the people waiting to eat. When you just woken up and want to get out to sight see this is a little annoying. The choice of food wasnt the best. You get crusty bread with cheese, pasteries and fruit. But some mornings they wouldnt have anything left. The last morning we were due to leave I only had a piece of toast and a hot chocolate because there was no milk or breads, I was starving to say the least. But overall I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family as its great. I would stay there again knowing I will have a good stay in a safe and warm environment.

Reviews.Title: “reccomended but...”
Reviews.Author: 2010ndy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and conveniently located but the overall breakfast service is poor. The breakfast itself is poor and the breakfast service is bad: The behavior of the particular lady who was on breakfast service from 2-4 September was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel In Good location”
Reviews.Author: Whitty85
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel in good location,just a 3 minute walk from Villiers metro station,we stayed here for a 3 night break for our 25th wedding annniversary & would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hansu_10
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in a good location. Friendly staff. Nothing to complain about the hotel or about the room. Neighbourhood was safe, but our arrival date and time was bad because we couldn't find any open restaurant nearby, so we ended up in a take away pizzeria, where pizza was quite expensive but really good.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinBrighton
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel, its around a 10 minute walk from the Number 2 metro line stop, forget the name of it. Lots of restaurants nearby and the hotel is located in a quiet area. My room was right beside the entrance and road but I heard more from neighbouring rooms where the walls seem to be quite thin. Bathroom tiny, but adequate. Breakfast a bit sparse but OK. Night receptionist was a bit grumpy but morning receptionists were very friendly. Ok for a couple of nights in Paris but do not expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a long weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MichaelCambridgeUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at Jardin de Villiers over a cold weekend in February. Good location near to the Metro in a good area with restaurants and shopping very close. Friendly and welcoming staff, room good (on the small size but OK) buffet/continental breakfast very good. Recommend booking direct (it is a Logis de France hotel) and found booking a couple of months before best value. We found the welcome, friendliness and helpfulness in Paris great and worth mentioning (except for a pompous security guard at the Trocedero). Would recommend Le P'tit Canon (just along from the hotel) and L'Auberge Rouge (closeby on rue de Toqueville) for eating out

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: VancouverMeeka
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last week and really enjoyed our stay! The Staff was friendly and although the main area of the hotel is a bit dated the rooms have been refurbished and look very modern and clean. It is typically small which is common in Europe but really no complaints! Rue De Levi market is well worth checking out! Very easy to get around the entire city from Villier station close by and the Monceau parc is worth taking a walk to! We did the Open bus tour (L'Open Bus tour) which was a good value and made it easy to see the city at our own pace. ***Keep in mind this hotel is not in the main touristy arear of Paris but this is what we loved about this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a real Parisienne experience”
Reviews.Author: sharklover75cc
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because there's a good chance we may have to move to Paris for my husband's job. This arrondisement will be fairly close for him to travel to work and still rates high on the safety, etc rankings for arrondisements. So we wanted to get a closer look. The hotel: Is very quaint. It's on a quiet residential side street. If you're light sleeper or really need your rest, I highly recommend this place! We had a courtyard room and just opened the window at night to let in a cool breeze. The rooms are extremely small, but that's typical for Europe. There's a small closet, desk, chair, bed, footstool, and small nightstands on either side of the bed. The bathroom was a little lacking in the repair area. The floor tiles were cracked, luckily they give you a pair of slippers. The towels are a little thread bare as someone else mentioned. But the shower alone is enough to make up for those 2 small things. I don't think I've ever had a nice a shower away from home as here. I seriously almost asked where they got the shower heads from...it was that good. Shampoo and soap is supplied. No washcloths though. The bathroom was very bright though, great for applying makeup or shaving. They do request you leave your key at the front desk when you leave. Kind of disturbing at first, especially since there are no safes in the rooms, but we didn't have any problems. And the key chain is kind of bulky, so I'm glad we didn't have to keep up with it. I'd suggest always carrying your passport and wallet with you. The breakfast was okay and traditional European flair...bread, pastries, jellies, yogurt and cheese. Juice, milk, coffee and tea. I highly recommend two restaurants near the hotel, I believe the hotel does too. If you exit to the right out of the hotel and go down to Legendre. Turn left and there's a pizza place. yum!! and if you turn right and head down a block or two to Crepe & Co. Excellent!! Another plus to this hotel is its proximity to 2 metro lines!! They go in opposite directions from this station, so there aren't too many places you can't get to! The neighborhood is great and I actually found it to be very similar to other neighborhoods in Paris. There's a great market street just around the corner from the hotel, with a grocery store, wine stores, restaurants, shops, etc...all to help you get a good look at Parisienne life! I highly recommend this hotel to the traveler who is looking for something outside the box of typical tourist hotels....and doesn't mind being an adventurer!

Reviews.Title: “Neat and cozy”
Reviews.Author: tp2009
Reviews.Content: Decent and neat rooms, about 2 blocks from Villiers Metro station. Elevator was quite small and hardly fit 3 people. Good breakfast and friendly English speaking staff. Lots of eateries and shops close by.

Reviews.Title: “the lovely 17th arrondisment beckons”
Reviews.Author: ktimene
Reviews.Content: Location-- great for a quiet weekend in the 17th, a very residential area. Some hidden street cafes and Rue Legendre are moments away, but the subway is a good 10 minutes. Please note that while the neighborhood is quiet, the doors are quite thin, and ofter there seemed to be the sound of someone scratching at our door in the morning, even if it was someone entering their own room across the hall. Rooms are small but lovely and clean. Ours had a view of the garden...and the backs of other apt blocks. The beds and the space are every bit as nice as they appear in the photos. The windows are huge, and we enjoyed the garden breeze from keeping both sets of windows open. Breakfast room cramped, but not such an issue unless you have a wheel chair or require other assistence. Ivan from the front desk infused real character into the hotel. We enjoyed our chats with him when we returned from our dinners. This is not a place to stay if you are into heavy-sightseeing or want to be in a central area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: roskey
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I (both from Ireland, age 24) stayed here for 5 nights at the end of july. The hotel is in a very quite area, perfect for a good nights sleep. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the nearby metro, 2 minutes from local markets and streets with supermarket, cafes, resturants etc. there is a dominos pizza 5 minutes away also. The location was perfect for us, only 5 minutes in the metro to the Champs Elyeese and the main tourist spots. The rooms were of a decent size, i beleive most hotels are small compared to other countries but there was enough room for 2 sharing. TV, hairdryer, nice bathroom etc. The breakfast wasnt great but you can get your fill if you arent picky. I would recommend the hotel to couples, singles, elderly or business people, i would not recommend it for familys with children. Staff are very helpful and a great help to first time Paris visitors. 24 hour reception is great.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighborhood, yet convenient location”
Reviews.Author: paroxario
Reviews.Content: Located in the 17th arrondisement, the hotel was close to the Villiers metro station, which is served by two metro lines. The hotel was on a very quiet street and one street over, there was a market where you could get fresh fruits along with lovely restaurants. The staff (Sebastien and his team) was really knowledgeable about the neighborhood restaurants and we enjoyed the meals we had at the different restaurants. The staff was attentive and responsive, and the rooms were comfortable. The hotel owner has an eclectic collection of modern art pieces.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: cgraversen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from the metro station Villiers - 3 stops from the Opera - the neighbourhood seems typical French with restaurants filled with locals. I stayed at the hotel for four nights after staying at another more expensive hotel for two nights. Here the service is good, the rooms are clean and newly refurbished. There is excellent Wifi connection in the room a good bed and a proper breakfast. If you're in Paris for business and a taste for authentic Paris milieu this is the place to choose. When you are here make sure to eat and drink at the local restaurant Le P'tit Canon with excellent French food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Modest hotel near the under-touristed Villiers neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Slightly apart from the many touristed neighborhoods of Paris, the area is typically Parisien and has a great pedestrianized street nearby with numerous restaurants and village shops. The hotel is modest and relatively basic, like many 3-star beds in Paris. If you get a good price and want to step out of the mainstream fray of touristy Paris, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Rovers426
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday night and were very disappointed to find most of the restaurants closed and the room small and dark, but the next morning everything seemed better and the hotel turned out to be in a good position for getting around Paris. Even so we thought it was a bit expensive for the quality, the breakfast was not very good and our room overlooked the rear of an office block. The bathroom was alright ,with a bath and it was clean but we could hardly hear the television as we could not turn up the volume.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MickyPa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardin De Villiers is a clean and cosy hotel somewhat close to the Moulin Rouge. The rooms were quite small, but were very clean and they served the purpose. In addition to a small refrigerator and a safe, the rooms had new flat screen televisions. The bathroom was spacious, and even though the window glass was frosted, we wished the window had a curtain, since we were on the first floor. The concierge was extremely nice and provided many tips for our trip to Paris. There is a parking garage within walking distance (at the end of the street) and the rate was 18 euro per day. The only thing that really disappointed us was the breakfast. We ate breakfast at the hotel on the first day and ate at local bakeries/cafes for the next two days. The hotel served bread, natural yogurt (no fruit flavors whatsoever), drinks and that was about it. The French bakeries offer some of the best pastries in the world, so check them out and avoid the hotel's breakfast. The Jardin De Villiers is a safe bet for a clean and comfortable room in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: BozeatTraveller
Reviews.Content: Close to the Metro – Villiers station – and with plenty of restaurants nearby; Le P’tit Canon at the end of the street is good value and popular with the locals. Rooms in the hotel are small – like many in Paris – but nicely decorated and equipped and have aircon for those hot summer nights. Reception is friendly, helpful and speak English!

Reviews.Title: “in the Jardin du Villiars”
Reviews.Author: werzp1
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Jardin du Villiars on the internet, after reading reviews we made reservations for 5 nights. We drove to the hotel and after unloading and checking in, turned the car in!! It is a lovely hotel located on a one block street, near shops, restaurents,laundrymat, markets....an old section with alot of character and got the neighborhood feeling. It is about 10 minutes, I'm a slow walker, from the metro. The walls are upolstred with fabic that matches the drapes, bathtub with European shower (hand held), hair dryer, good toilet paper. Our room overlooked the garden and was very quiet. Breakfast was served in the cellar in a charming atmosphere. We enjoy the European breakfast and always get plenty to eat. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It has a lift but the last 2 days we were there it didn't work, I have knee trouble so I didn't go up and down and more than was needed.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Transfers”
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireSatnav
Reviews.Content: Worcestershire Travellers -UK. I booked this hotel direct through the web site after reading mostly good reviews. I also booked transfers as advertised on the web page i.e. CDGAirport to hotel @ 17Euros pp. My wife and I arrived at CDG at 2015 to find no meet and greet. The RER service to Garde de Norde was ok but from there it only got worse. To obtain metro tickets then walk for to line 2 station takes at least 20 mins. When you arrive at Viillers stop when its raining at 1030 at night with only the small hotel map it is no fun. Arriving at last at the hotel the reception staff informed us that it was the "Companies" fault -the light dawned they were using a transport company not as advertised their own mini bus and driver!! The hotel stay was OK Small room but all was adequate except for the broken room safe (No keypad). Breakfast is typical french minimalistic. We tried to book transfers for the return journey but guess what the "Company" did not wish to now about two travellers . We eventually took a taxi pre booked by the Hotel for 51 euros - we just couldn't face the trek acrooss the Garde de Norde. So beware if you book transfers!!

HotelInfo.Name: Logis Jardin De Villiers
